title: pagina di youtube non mi mostra le anteprime e mi scrive "prova a cercare qualcosa"
content:
su uno dei miei PC, quando vado, con Firefox, su https://www.youtube.com , senza fare login, non mi escono più le anteprime di video visti precedentemente; mi esce il messaggio

Prova a cercare qualcosa Inizia a riprodurre video per aiutarci a elaborare un feed di contenuti che amerai.

ho provato a

- cancellare i cookie - disinstallare e reinstallare Firefox - tornare a vecchio punto di ripristino Windows 10 - prendere il profilo Firefox di altro PC

ma non funziona

quale è il problema? Vi allego lo screen
creator: alecard2000

title: Firefox
content:
Prezados Senhores,

Quando eu mudo a página do Firefox, através de um programa externo, e depois tento voltar para a página anterior, a página aparece na tela, mas fica completamente INATIVA, e a barra de endereços também não muda para a minha página anterior. É um problema GRAVÍSSIMO que só acontece com o Firefox. Várias das suas sugestões já foram posta em prática, incluindo-se a reinstalação, mas, sem sucesso. Como faço para resolver?

Grato, Maciel Volante, macielvt@hotmail.com
creator: macielvt

title: Firefox opens on start up to a random webpage
content:
2 weeks ago I visited a git hub page to try to find a solution to my Logitech keyboard problem.

Then all of a sudden I noticed that on start up, this webpage kept automatically opening. Needless to say, I have disabled open on start. I have cleared cache data, refreshed the browser and uninstalled and reinstalled. Nothing gets rid of this opening webpage.

Why? Even when the browser is uninstalled, something keeps attempting to execute the command / process to open this webpage. How can I kill it? I did download only an afk file, surely it wasn't a virus? This is just a random person from Israel who posted about a keyboard. Surely I am not hacked? Please help me kill this random problem.

To reiterate, this website automatically opens on start up on matter what.

https://github.com/YosfanEilay/Fix-keyboard-DDDouble-Tyypingg/blob/350abb80b09e2ce898d9e64de158485cfd10c694/Double%20Typing%20Fix.ahk
creator: swashy893

title: I am working for an Organization.
content:
HI Team,

I am working for an organization, members have different versions installed and need help to uninstall the Firefox completely, Member able to see the application installed in Apps and features and but files do not exist in program files or program files x86, please someone please contact me for my queries [removed phone# from support forum]. my email id [edited] @gmail.com

The script is not removing the application

IF EXIST "%ProgramFiles%\Mozilla Firefox\" ( "%ProgramFiles%\Mozilla Firefox\uninstall\helper.exe" /s )

IF EXIST "%Program Files (x86)%\Mozilla Firefox\" ( "%Program Files (x86)%\Mozilla Firefox\uninstall\helper.exe" /s )
creator: sijikarial

title: Youtube video player not working properly - defaults back to a different player.
content:
When playing videos on YouTube while signed into my Google account, YouTube sooner or later defaults to a different video player (according to a friend of mine, it is a fallback video player). To get back to the "normal" video player, I have to log out of my Google account, restart Firefox, and then log back in. This problem only seems to occur a longer while after logging back into my account, but it is recurring.

This only started happening after I downloaded Google Chrome and installer two plugins as a part of testing (supposedly used to HTML code extraction). I did remove both extensions, and then uninstalled Chrome, but the issue persists.

Is there any way to combat this?
creator: honza.kvapil.jk

title: Firefox saved password last used date says today, but I have not used those passwords today at all
content:
Hello

I recently reinstalled firefox . After I logged into my firefox account it synced everything.

When I check my password manager it said my passwords for 2 sites were last "used" today. It's after midnight now so it would have been in the last 1 - 2 hours.

One of the websites had a 2nd factor authentication and nothing came to my phone. I am just wondering if this was a password manager glitch or something to worry about. The place I synced is my family computer and no one else would log onto those sites since they are work sites. And again it's midnight the other computer is off too.
creator: flints16

title: Saved passwords
content:
Hi,

I've been using Firefox on my laptop and my phones for years. I have a concern about my saved passwords in Firefox. If I need to lookup a password, I go settings, saved logins, put in my pin# and search and copy my password. Many times; however, when I get to the enter password on a website, Firefox comes up above my keypad and will let me just hit the down button to pick my credentials and automatically fills in my credentials without asking for my pin! It will also come up above keyboard to unlock Firefox? Please help me to clear this mess up. I want to have to put in a pin for my passwords. Anyone could get into my websites if my phone were taken, etc. I know I un-installed the app for passwords from Firefox when it was no longer available, sorry can't remember name of this app. I hope there is an easy way to make this happen. The only way I want to look for a password is with a pin #. It's a pain but I am OK with this.
creator: ingdas408
